content:
Sure, here's a restatement with character names and real-world musical acts:

Episode 1: "Opening Night"
JD, the stage manager, Fish, the lighting technician, and Joe Francois, the sound technician, are getting ready for opening night at The Gig. The musical act for this episode is the New Orleans-based band The Revivalists. The B plot for this episode follows Fish as she tries to convince JD to let her have more creative control over the lighting design for the shows. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a malfunctioning soundboard.

Episode 2: "The Road Crew"
A new band and road crew arrive at The Gig, and tensions rise between the crew and the staff. The musical act for this episode is the indie rock band TV On The Radio. The B plot follows JD and Fish as they try to keep the band's roadies from damaging the club's equipment. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a difficult lead singer who wants the sound mix to be just right.

Episode 3: "The Headliner"
The staff prepares for a big-name act at The Gig, and tensions are high. The musical act for this episode is the blues-rock guitarist Gary Clark Jr. The B plot follows Fish as she struggles to create a unique lighting design for the show that will do justice to the headlining act. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a temperamental drummer who wants the levels just right.

Episode 4: "The After-Party"
The staff at The Gig deals with the aftermath of a wild party. The musical act for this episode is the soulful singer-songwriter Leon Bridges. The B plot follows JD and Fish as they try to find out who left a stash of drugs in the dressing room. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a hungover lead singer who needs his help to make it through the soundcheck.

Episode 5: "The Newbie"
A new stagehand, Lily, joins the crew, and the veteran staff members take her under their wing. The musical act for this episode is the indie folk band Lord Huron. The B plot follows Lily as she tries to prove herself to JD and Fish. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a problem with the monitor system.

Episode 6: "The Rival Club"
A rival club tries to poach one of The Gig's bands, and tensions rise between the staff and the rival club. The musical act for this episode is the up-and-coming rock band Black Pumas. The B plot follows JD as he tries to convince the band to stay loyal to The Gig. The C plot involves Fish dealing with a difficult request from the lead singer for an elaborate lighting display.

Episode 7: "The Show Must Go On"
The staff is faced with a crisis when the headlining band's bus breaks down on the way to The Gig. The musical act for this episode is the funky R&B band Vulfpeck. The B plot follows JD as he scrambles to find a replacement act. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with a problem with the main speaker system.

Episode 8: "The Last Night"
In the season finale, the staff prepares for the last night of the season. The musical act for this episode is the indie pop band Haim. The B plot follows Fish as she reflects on the past season and what it has meant to her. The C plot involves Joe Francois dealing with the owner's decision about whether to sell The Gig to a big corporation.
